For many topics in this class, we are going to be only scratching the surface. Below you can find some links that can help you learn more.

### R cheatsheets

-   Official cheatsheets from [Posit](https://posit.co/resources/cheatsheets/)

### Version control with git

-   [Git, GitHub, and Version Control](https://www.crumplab.com/psyc3470/compendium/version_control.html) by Matt Crump
-   [Happy Git with R](https://happygitwithr.com/) by Jenny Bryan

### Statistical analysis with R

-   [Learning Statistics with R](https://learningstatisticswithr.com/book/) by Danielle Navarro
-   [Answering Questions with Data](https://www.crumplab.com/statistics/) by Matt Crump, Danielle Navarro, and Jeffrey Suzuki

### Data visualization

-   [ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis](https://ggplot2-book.org/) by Hadley Wickham, Danielle Navarro, and Thomas Lin Pedersen

### Similar ideas, different language: Resources for learning Python

-   [Python vs R: What's the Difference?](https://www.ibm.com/think/topics/python-vs-r)
-   [Lab in Cognition and Perception](https://cims.nyu.edu/~brenden/courses/labincp/intro.html) by Todd Gureckis

### Natural language processing with R

-   [Tidy Text Mining](https://www.tidytextmining.com/) by Julia Silge and David Robinson

### Advanced programming with R

-   [Advanced R](https://adv-r.hadley.nz/) by Hadley Wickham

### Basic computer skills

-   How to zip files: [mac](https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/zip-and-unzip-files-and-folders-on-mac-mchlp2528/mac), [windows](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/zip-and-unzip-files-8d28fa72-f2f9-712f-67df-f80cf89fd4e5)
-   [Common Mac terminal commands](https://www.techrepublic.com/article/16-terminal-commands-every-user-should-know/)

### Searching for datasets

-   [Datasets used in this course](~/datasets)
-   Psychology datasets published on the [Open Science Framework](https://osf.io/)
